briefTitle: Study of Safety and Efficacy of an Oral Contraceptive
officialTitle: Open-Label Study of the Safety and Efficacy of a Low Dose Oral Contraceptive Containing Norethindrone Acetate and Ethinyl Estradiol
summary: This is a non-comparative study. The primary objective of the study is to assess the efficacy of a low dose oral contraceptive in the prevention of pregnancy. The secondary objectives are to assess the incidence of intracyclic bleeding; and to assess the safety and tolerability of the product.

primaryOutcome.measure: Pregnancy Rate (Expressed as Pearl Index) in Women Aged 18 to 35, MITT Population,
